variable.comment: It is used to know if the Game is paused
variable.name: Pause2

variable.comment: Just in case we need to keep track of time passage
variable.name: TimePassed2

variable.comment: Use the name of the game to replace the xxx
variable.name: HighScoreKey2

events.comment: Make sure that the Menu is displayed the 1st time we play the game
Make sure everything moves left across the screen (since the default 0 degrees is right)

sub-events.comment: Loads the HighScore at the start of the game
If it is the first time the game is played we just load 0

events.comment: Making sure we can move around the different levels

sub-events.comment: Updating the Highscore in case we have a new one

event-group.description: Support for Windows 8 snapped view. Shows the Pause layer and freezes the game loop.
event-group.title: Windows 9

sub-events.comment: Updating the Highscore in case we have a new one
NOT TESTED But should work, same logic as for mouse
From now, we test the Trigs. Each one have a specific Pos instance variable, to know where it is, and so execute the according action.

Depending on the behaviors of your main object/type of game, you will want to execute different things. Here we go with the car behavior to control the movement of a car. Default controls property of the car behavior has been set to no, we control it all in events from here.
E for east/right, we steer right
W for west/left, we steer left
